DOC.brief_summary: There several benefit over-the-counter medication , yet little research evaluate increase patient compliance health care provider suggest over-the-counter ( OTC ) medication . We evaluate two type physician direction see increase patient compliance OTC medication .
DOC.detailed_description: Researchers identify cohort gynecologic patient present annual examination offer participation study . Physician researcher randomize patient 2 type physician direction OTC medication , follow compliance course next 7 month . A total 123 participant arm undergo recruitment , total 246 participant recruit . Inclusion criterion include : female , non-pregnant patient present annual gynecologic examination age 19-50 . Exclusion criterion include : outside study age range , patient take thyroid medication , history kidney stone , history hypercalcemia , non-English speaking .
DOC.criteria: Female patient undergo annual gynecologic examination . Ages 1950 . Patients currently take certain OTC medication . Pregnancy . History hypercalcemia . History kidney stone . Outside study age range 1950 . Patient take thyroid medication .
